meanings.definition: A loud, harsh, piercing cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The screech of the car brakes startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a screech coming from the owl in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The screech of the alarm clock woke me up with a jolt.
meanings.sent4: The screech of the microphone feedback made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent5: The screech of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh, piercing cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The cat will screech if you step on its tail.
meanings.sent2: I hope the brakes don't screech when I stop the car.
meanings.sent3: The toddler loves to screech with joy when playing with toys.
meanings.sent4: The wind can screech through the trees on stormy nights.
meanings.sent5: The singer can screech high notes effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The screech of the whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent2: The screech of the teapot indicated that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent3: The screech of the brakes made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: The screech of the violin filled the concert hall with music.
meanings.sent5: The screech of the seagulls echoed across the beach.
